item.title: Developing Satellaview games with PVSnesLib
item.description: This is a demo to showcase the way I integrate Satellaview features to a PVSnesLib project. Video of the demo: https://youtu.be/HI_O6bwIuIU Download the rom (bs-demo-mpack.bs): https://github.com/Krokodyl/bsdemo-mpack First, you need to have the PVSnesLib environment set up. Follow the instructions on the wiki and try to compile any of the examples provided to make sure it’s working. Second, you can get the sources for the demo by cloning or downloading the github repository below.

item.title: Make your own Parabo's Game Quiz
item.description: Parabo’s Game Quiz is a homebrew game for the Satellaview (the Super Famicom extension). It is a quiz where you have to identify games from a blurry screenshot. Here is the template you can use to make your own quiz. Send me all the files and I will compile your own version of the game. The original version has 12 rounds but you can make any number of rounds (within reason).

item.title: Parabo's Game Quiz I
item.description: Parabo’s Game Quiz is a homebrew game for the Satellaview (the Super Famicom extension). It is a quiz where you have to identify NES games from a blurry screenshot. Download Music + SFX SFX only Parabo’s Game Quiz I.bs Parabo’s Game Quiz I (NO BGM).bs Gameplay Each round you are granted 20 credits to spend on hints in order to help you identify the game. Hint Effect Unblur Makes the image slightly unblurry.

item.title: WaiWai Check 11/22 (English)
item.description: WaiWai Check 11/22 (わいわいチェック 11/22) is a Satellaview game. The ROM was originally dumped through the effort of several people and published on the Satellablog. Roms (Japanese and English) Japanese ROM English Patch On Satellablog ROM CRC32: 701009F1 Download Wai Wai Check (11-22) (English).bps The game The game is a “spot the difference” game. You have an animated image on the left and the mirrored version on the right with 5 differences.

item.title: Dynami Tracer - Extra Content
item.description: Prizes Like many Satellaview games, Dynami Tracer ends with a postcard that shows the player score and a password used to verify that score. Players would write down and send their postcard to St.GIGA in order to receive gifts, such as telephone card. The highest scores also entered a raffle where the winners were awarded a certificate of excellence. Translation Send a postcard with your score and the password that will be shown after completing the game to St.

item.title: Dynami Tracer Quiz
item.description: Normal Quiz - Questions and Answers ⚠ All answers must be typed in uppercase! ID Question Answer 19 No idea what they are but their ride is a mysterious fish. They’re contestant #6. What is Jim’s name? TASOGARENO 1A The Mitsutomo Galaxy Company is hosting this Dynami Trace. What is Mr. Mitsutomo’s first name? KONOSUKE 1B What is the name of the vehicle of contestant #2, Rose Tetsuwan? MACH MARY 1C He’s a very quiet bearded man.

item.title: Dynami Tracer (English)
item.description: Content The game English Patch Characters Vehicles Treasure list Planet Twin Star Planet Octave Planet Skull Bone Planet Adults Planet Clockwork Star Monster Stomach Normal Quiz Cult Quiz Satella Sand Planet Planet Minimum Star Credits The game This is the last of 4 games developed by Squaresoft for the Satellaview, the extension of the Super Famicom (SNES). The other games being Radical Dreamers, Koi wa Balance and Treasure Conflix.

item.title: Wordle for SNES (Satebo's Wordgame)
item.description: Satebo’s Wordgame is a homebrew game for the Satellaview (the Super Famicom extension). It is an implementation of the Wordle game, developped by Josh Wardle, that became popular in 2021 before being bought by the New York Times. The game is named after Satebo, one of the two Satellaview mascots. (Satebo: ) and Parabo: ) Why did you spell wordgame in one word? I don’t know, why is wargame spelled in one word?

item.title: How to play Satellaview games on PC
item.description: Prerequisite Have a SNES emulator that supports Satellaview (BS) games. 1. Download the Satellaview BIOS The file can be downloaded on the BS-X Project Blog BS-X BIOS (English) [No DRM] [2016 v1.3].sfc I recommend taking the ENGLISH + NO DRM version. 2. Place the BIOS in your emulator config (optional) Some emulators automatically look for the BIOS in a specific folder or with a specific file name. Either way, you should keep it in a known location, as you’ll need it.

item.title: Treasure Conflix (French)
item.description: Traduction française du jeu Satellaview (SNES/Super Famicom) トレジャーコンフリクス (Treasure Conflix) sortie en 1996 par Squaresoft. Le jeu mélange des éléments de RPG avec des combats aériens en mode 7. Cependant, l’essentiel du jeu consiste à parler à des PNJ et à résoudre des énigmes pour trouver des trésors. Conseils pour une première partie Utiliser L et R avec le D-pad pour tourner plus vite. On ne peut trouver un trésor qu’après avoir obtenu un indice ou une carte pour ce trésor.

item.title: Treasure Conflix - All Treasure Locations
item.description: There are 32 treasures to find in the game (not counting the Cloud Gate, which is the main story element). 20 of the treasures are found with a clue given by an NPC. 8 of the treasures are found using a treasure map given by an NPC. 4 of the treasures are underwater in the Doom Triangle. World Map Click here for world map World Map Full Resolution (4096x4096) Treasure Locations Amethyst Bracelet Click here for the treasure location Ancient Coin Click here for the treasure location Ancient Scriptures Click here for the treasure location Angel’s Bow Click here for the treasure location Black Coral Hairpin Click here for the treasure location Cat’s Eye Click here for the treasure location Cursed Mirror Click here for the treasure location Diamond Ring Click here for the treasure location Underwater in the Doom Triangle (Dark waters around the Salvage Ship)

item.title: Treasure Conflix (English)
item.description: English translation for the Satellaview (SNES/Super Famicom) game トレジャーコンフリクス (Treasure Conflix) released in 1996 by Squaresoft. The game mixes RPG elements with some airship fights in mode 7. Most of the focus is on talking with NPCs and solving riddles trying to find the locations of treasures. Tips for your first playthrough You can use L and R in conjunction with the D-pad to turn faster while in combat. You can only find a treasure after you’ve been given the clue or the map for that treasure.

item.title: WaiWai Check 03/21 (English)
item.description: Waiwai Check 3/21 (わいわいチェック 3/21) is a Satellaview game. The ROM was originally dumped through the effort of several people and published on the Satellablog. As the game was packed together with another one, I took the liberty to extract the game and rebuild a working pack with the game alone. Roms (Japanese and English) Japanese ROM English ROM Download WaiWai Check 3-21 (Japanese).bs Download WaiWai Check 3-21 (English).bs The game The game is a “spot the difference” game.

item.title: Yuki no WaiWai Kids (English)

Roms (Japanese and English) Japanese ROM English ROM Download WaiWai Kids 3-16 (Japanese).bs Download WaiWai Kids 3-16 (English).

item.title: Koi wa Balance (English)
item.description: English translation for the 1996 Satellaview (an extension of the Super Famicom/Super Nintendo only released in Japan) game Koi wa Balance: Tatoeba K-kun no Tabou na Ichinichi Hen. The Japanese title (恋はバランス たとえばK君の多忙な一日編) roughly translates to “Love is balance - for example, K’s busy day”. Sometimes referred as Koi ha Balance - Battle of Lovers (は is ha when out of context but read as wa as a particle). This is a party game for up to 4 players in which you play as one of four brothers who are competing in a challenge set up by their dying grand-father, head of the family business.
